remarks: Lemma for ~ sylow1 .  Using Lagrange's theorem and the orbit-stabilizer theorem, show that there is a subgroup with size exactly ` P ^ N ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jan-2015.)
statement:
sylow1.x $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
sylow1.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
sylow1.f $e |- ( ph -> X e. Fin ) $.
sylow1.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. Prime ) $.
sylow1.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
sylow1.d $e |- ( ph -> ( P ^ N ) || ( # ` X ) ) $.
sylow1lem.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
sylow1lem.s $e |- S = { s e. ~P X | ( # ` s ) = ( P ^ N ) } $.
sylow1lem.m $e |- .(+) = ( x e. X , y e. S |-> ran ( z e. y |-> ( x .+ z ) ) ) $.
sylow1lem3.1 $e |- .~ = { <. x , y >. | ( { x , y } C_ S /\ E. g e. X ( g .(+) x ) = y ) } $.
sylow1lem4.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. S ) $.
sylow1lem4.h $e |- H = { u e. X | ( u .(+) B ) = B } $.
sylow1lem5.l $e |- ( ph -> ( P pCnt ( # ` [ B ] .~ ) ) <_ ( ( P pCnt ( # ` X ) ) - N ) ) $.
sylow1lem5 $p |- ( ph -> E. h e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ( # ` h ) = ( P ^ N ) ) $.
